articles.author: Ben Blanchard
articles.description: China ended two days of war games around Taiwan, in which it simulated attacks with bombers and practiced boarding ships, and Taiwan's defence ministry detailed on Saturday the surge of Chinese warplanes and warships involved.
articles.title: China ends war games, Taiwan details warplane, warship surge

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: More than 300 people and over 1,100 houses were buried by a massive landslide that levelled a remote village in northern Papua New Guinea, local media reported on Saturday.
articles.title: More than 300 buried in Papua New Guinea landslide, local media says

articles.author: Layli Foroudi, Juliette Jabkhiro
articles.description: In 2018, a year after becoming France's president, Emmanuel Macron flew to the remote French-ruled Pacific island of New Caledonia to outline his latest foreign policy plan.
articles.title: In restive New Caledonia, Macron sees Pacific power and influence

articles.author: Bianca Flowers, Stephanie Kelly
articles.description: Momentum has waned and legislative efforts have stalled, leaving communities, advocates, and families frustrated.
articles.title: Four years after George Floyd killing, police reform slow to follow

articles.author: Shivam Patel
articles.description: Suhel Mansuri, who carries scars from Hindu-Muslim riots that killed dozens in his district of India's capital in 2020, says his vote on Saturday in national elections was for "peace and brotherhood" as divisive religious rhetoric rises.
articles.title: India voters in Delhi, scarred by Hindu-Muslim riots, want peace

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Forty three people who were on board a Singapore Airlines flight that hit severe turbulence remain hospitalised in Bangkok four days after the emergency, a hospital in the Thai capital said on Saturday.
articles.title: Thai hospital says 43 people from Singapore Airlines flight still under treatment

articles.author: Sakshi Dayal
articles.description: The world's largest election may become the hottest on Saturday, as Indians participate in the next-to-last phase of voting with temperatures forecast to surge to 47 degrees Celsius (117 degrees Fahrenheit) in the capital New Delhi.
articles.title: India's massive election faces heatwave challenge in penultimate phase

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The G7 will explore ways of using the future income from frozen Russian assets to help Ukraine, finance chiefs from the Group of Seven industrial democracies said on Saturday, according to a draft statement seen by Reuters.
articles.title: G7 will try to use frozen Russian assets to help Ukraine

articles.author: Stephanie Van Den Berg, Anthony Deutsch
articles.description: Judges at the top United Nations court ordered Israel on Friday to halt its military assault on the southern Gaza city of Rafah.
articles.title: World Court orders Israel to halt assault on Gaza's Rafah

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least five people were killed and several others were missing after an informal gold mine collapsed in northern Kenya, officials and local media said.
articles.title: Five killed after informal gold mine collapses in northern Kenya
